title: Willen Lake Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Steve Daniels / Willen Lake
images.caption: People feed the ducks and geese at the site.

images.title: Andrew R Tester / Peace Pagoda
images.caption: Willen Village and Lake. The low winter sunshine picks out the village at the other side of the water.

images.title: George Mahoney / Peace Pagoda
images.caption: Peace Pagoda. The Peace Pagoda at the park was the first to be built in the northern hemisphere in 1980. Sacred relics of Lord Buddha are enshrined here. It's located in the parkland area on the western side of the lake.

images.title: Steve Daniels / Japanese Buddhist Temple at Willen
images.caption: Japanese Buddhist Temple at Willen. It's on the western side, just south of the peace pagoda.

images.title: Steve Daniels / The Lakeside at Willen Lake
images.caption: The Lakeside pub

images.title: Richard Schmidt / BMX Track
images.caption: BMX Track. The purpose build BMX Track in Pineham, to the north east of the site.

description: Willen Lake is Milton Keynes most popular park with a super waterside cycling and walking path to enjoy. The easy circular trail runs for a distance of about 2.6 miles around the perimeter of the lake. There's also pedalos, mini-golf and a cafe at the site. If you would like to continue your outing you could pick up the nearby Grand Union Canal Walk or the Hanslope Circular Ride. Just to the north west you will find Linford Lakes -a lovely nature reserve in Milton Keynes with a number of pretty lakes and ponds. If you head a couple of miles south along the Grand Union Canal you'll some come to Caldecotte Lake where you can enjoy more waterside walking and cycling.
